item.title: Tokkul to gold converter problem
item.dc:creator: @play_4_fun play 4 fun
item.description:
@play_4_fun wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:8, topic:396840”]I got a converter through object code that works fairly well.

if(objectID == 2182) { if(playerHasItem(996, 100)) { deleteItem(996, getItemSlot(996), 100); addItem(995, 100000000); sM("You exchange your Coin Credits for coins!"); } else sM("You need 100 Coin Credits to transfer into coins."); } [/quote]

sorry im new to coding, i know my works pretty sloppy, just the tutorials i see are easy and i know commands pretty well now. Do you think a npc would be better to exchange through? and no thats the only command that converts. =/

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkul to gold converter problem
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I got a converter through object code that works fairly well.

if(objectID == 2182) {
if(playerHasItem(996, 100)) {
deleteItem(996, getItemSlot(996), 100);
addItem(995, 100000000);
sM("You exchange your Coin Credits for coins!");
} else
sM("You need 100 Coin Credits to transfer into coins.");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkul to gold converter problem
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

[quote=“play 4 fun, post:5, topic:396840”][quote author=4markie link=topic=494002.msg3611587#msg3611587 date=1306632560]

edit:: 1 more prob with the command. if you have more than 500 tokkul and use t2g it uses all your tokkul and gives you only the amount for the command typed

Sorry can you re-phrase that? I don’t understand
[/quote]

ok say you have 501 or 1000 tokkul and use ::t2g500 - meaning 500tokkul gives 50k. it will use all 501 or 1000 tokkul if you use this command and only give you 50k. is there a way to just make it lose 500 tokkul for 50k no more and no less and someone just reped me so im going to rep you for helping me get this far :)[/quote]

Oh I understand now, thanks for the rep too.

Anyhow, that’s very odd that it’s doing that.

This line of code should ensure it doesn’t do that:
c.getItems().deleteItem(6529, 500);

Are there any other t2g commands in your server other than the one you’re showing me?

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkul to gold converter problem
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

Try this

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("t2g500") && c.playerRights >= 0) { if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(6529, 500)){ c.getItems().deleteItem(6529, 500); c.getItems().addItem(995, 50000); c.sendMessage("Here ya go 50k well earned!"); } if(!c.getItems().playerHasItem(6529, 500)){ c.sendMessage("Not enough tokkul!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Tokkul to gold converter problem
item.dc:creator: @play_4_fun play 4 fun
item.description:
@play_4_fun wrote:

ok so i have a tokkul store, still messed up. everything costs 0 tokkul but you cant buy anything, idk whats wrong… this is question #1.

then because i have a tokkul store where you can only get certain items at, i added a converter. you can convert tokkul into gold and im going to make it the other way around but i came across 1 problem. I put the code in and its ::t2g500 or whatever amount you want to do. when your on and type it in, you dont need that amount to claim the money? you can type ::t2g500 and have 1 tokkul and still claim your money. PLease help? code beloww

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“t2g500”) && c.playerRights >= 0) {
c.getItems().playerHasItem(6529, 500);
c.getItems().deleteItem(6529, 500);
c.getItems().addItem(995, 50000);
c.sendMessage(“Here ya go 50k well earned!”);
}

Read full topic
